pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [931706af62](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20774/commits/931706af62ffcba0c2fb3d506f20b21d6609bb96)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ LinearIndependent.map_of_surjective_injectiveₛ`
`+ lift_rank_le_of_injective_injectiveₛ`
`+ rank_le_of_injective_injectiveₛ`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>Decrease in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (2.00, 0.00)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|1414|-2|erw|

Current commit [931706af62](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/931706af62ffcba0c2fb3d506f20b21d6609bb96)
Reference commit [0d3784625d](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/0d3784625d21570a7f5e475ae27e34177107f6c3)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/9dc47c9d-91b4-4662-ba41-b77736e573e3) for commit 31b132339de99f23ecba8ff298c1aa9d11e98c43.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/14135b2a-780b-4bc8-8677-43ae510d414f) for commit a57a0919710b49ec887f27f7f70de487f57b1b57.
There were [significant changes](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/compare/7fc072c4-ad2a-45cd-9b98-06ca3d7136cf/to/14135b2a-780b-4bc8-8677-43ae510d414f) against commit 59c1bde08d635af6a642bb929a9e4135db1aae05:
```diff
  Benchmark                                Metric         Change
  ==============================================================
+ ~Mathlib.FieldTheory.Relrank             instructions    -3.2%
+ ~Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Dimension.Basic   instructions   -47.7%
```
I fear that if you don't add a comment explaining why this line is there, it will be deleted again in the near future.

Whoever removes it should feel a big slowdown (likely a timeout). If not, why should we block the removal?
If there's a tracking issue for such slow instances on CoeSort of subobjects, it would be appropriate to refer to it, so as to remind us to remove this `let _` when the issue is fixed.

pullRequest.title: chore(LinearAlgebra): generalize results on ranks to semirings
